business.headline: India's November Russian oil imports set to hit 5-month high amid US tariffsIndia, the world's third-largest oil importer, has been the biggest buyer of discounted seaborne Russian crude after Russia was shunned by Western countries following its 2022 invasion of Ukraine.
Sensex closes 314 points lower, Nifty below 26,000; Infosys down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 313.70 points to close at 84,587.01, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 74.70 points to end at 25,884.80.

Do new Labour Codes hit Narayana Murthy's 9-9-6 dreams?India's new Labour Codes cap workweeks at 48 hours, with flexibility on scheduling, overtime pay, and a mandatory day of rest. But as industry leaders like Narayana Murthy push for 72-hour weeks and L&T's SN Subrahmanyan praises 90-hour schedules, many are raising questions whether these reforms will hold ground in a culture where overwork is routine.

Waiting for your IPO to list? Here's how opening price on markets is decidedMost retail investors have little idea how the opening price for an IPO is decided. They often rely on grey market premium (GMP), hype, and subscription figures to guess the listing level, even though none of these factors directly set the price.

Do the new labour codes put full-time jobs at risk?Fixed-term jobs just got a major boost under the new labour codes. But does this new flexibility mean full-time roles are at risk, or will companies find a new balance altogether?

India–US trade deal looks quiet. The 'energy' shift tells another storyIndia and the US may look stalled on a formal trade deal, but shifting oil flows, a major LPG pact and calibrated tariff moves show the real progress is happening quietly behind the scenes.
Sensex opens 100 points lower, Nifty below 26,000; Infosys down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 16.48 points to 84,884.23, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 4.55 points to 25,954.95 as of 9:28 am.

Sudeep Pharma IPO closes today: Is it worth a bid? Check the GMPThe Rs 895-crore IPO includes a fresh issue of Rs 95 crore and an offer for sale worth Rs 800 crore. The price band is set at Rs 563 to Rs 593 per share, and the minimum investment for retail buyers is Rs 14,825.
Apple layoff: Tech giant cuts jobs across sales team, says reportApple said it is reducing roles across its sales teams as part of a plan to improve how it engages with customers.
Sensex closes 331 points lower, Nifty below 26,000; BEL down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 331.21 points to close at 84,900.71, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 108.65 points to end at 25,959.50.

GST 2.0 is lifting consumption. Can it lift Sensex and Nifty too?GST 2.0 has pushed prices down and demand up, but whether that momentum can lift Sensex and Nifty will depend on earnings, capex and global stability in the months ahead.

Tejas crash at Dubai Airshow isolated occurrence: Read HAL's full statementAn Indian Air Force Tejas fighter jet crashed in the United Arab Emirates on Friday while taking part in the Dubai Airshow 2025.

Who is Rama Raju Mantena, pharma king behind Udaipur's star-studded wedding?Rama Raju Mantena is a well-known name in the US pharmaceutical industry. Originally from Vijayawada in Andhra Pradesh, Mantena moved to the United States in the 1980s.
HAL share price falls 4% after Tejas fighter jet crash at Dubai AirshowThe HAL stock slipped to around Rs 4,430, down roughly 3.6% at 10:44 am. Earlier in the day, the stock had tumbled over 8%.

Excelsoft Technologies IPO allotment out: Did you get shares? Check listing detailsExcelsoft Technologies IPO allotment: Applicants who subscribed to the IPO can check their status through the BSE website or the registrar, MUFG Intime India Pvt Ltd.

Sensex, Nifty start week on a positive note as IT stocks lead the chargeBroader market indices were also in the green, mirroring the positive start. The tone was set by IT heavyweights: Tech Mahindra and Infosys jumped over 2% each, followed closely by gains in HCLTech and Wipro. Eicher Motors also featured among the early winners.

TCS suffers legal setback in US with $194 million penalty upheldThe matter has now been sent back to the Northern District of Texas, Dallas Division, which has been asked to review the injunction as per the directions of the Appeals Court.

Why billionaire Lakshmi Mittal is saying goodbye to the UKAs per the Forbes rich list, Mittal has a net worth of $21.4 billion. He is the 12th richest Indian and the 104th richest person in the world.

New labour codes: 10 key changes every employee should knowWhether someone works full-time, on a contract, or in sector-specific roles like media, plantations or factories, the new framework affects nearly everyone. Here are the key updates workers should be aware of, along with several other important changes that haven't received enough attention.

Feel cheated by your family will? Know your legal rightsWhether it is a sudden change in beneficiaries, unequal division of property, or doubts about the person's mental state when the will was written, such situations often create confusion, anger, and emotional stress.

entertainment.headline: Lupita Nyong'o was stereotyped in slave roles after Oscar win for 12 Years A Slave Despite her Oscar win, Lupita Nyong'o initially only received offers for stereotypical slave roles. It led her to consciously choose diverse projects and become a "joyful warrior for changing the paradigms of what it means to be African."

Dhurandhar's Ishq Jalakar – Karvaan: A pulsating reimagining of Roshan's classic The makers of upcoming film Dhurandhar have released the first song, Ishq Jalakar - Karvaan, ahead of schedule following enthusiastic response from audiences. The track, a reimagining of a classic, features Ranveer Singh.

The RajaSaab director shares shoot details, says Prabhas filmed in freezing cold Prabhas's 'The RajaSaab' is set for a major global release in January 2026. The makers recently emphasised how the actor braved extreme cold to film its musical sequences.

Very subjective: Rakul Preet Singh on Deepika Padukone's 8-hour working controversy Rakul Preet Singh has addressed the ongoing 8-hour shift debate in Bollywood, saying work hours should depend on an actor's stage of life and personal priorities. She stressed that there "can't be one rule for anybody" and cited examples from Amitabh Bachchan to 90s stars like Ajay Devgn and Akshay Kumar.

Who is Palaash Muchhal, musician at centre of wedding turmoil with Smriti Mandhana? The wedding of Indian cricketer Smriti Mandhana and musician-filmmaker Palaash Muchhal, scheduled for November 23 in Sangli, Maharashtra, was cancelled at the last minute following a sudden health emergency. Here's a closer look at the man at the centre of today's headlines.

Jaideep Ahlawat mourns Dharmendra, recalls warm moments from Ikkis sets Jaideep Ahlawat shared a heartfelt tribute to Dharmendra, reflecting on their time together during the shooting of Ikkis. Dharmendra, who died in Mumbai at 89, leaves behind a six-decade-long cinematic legacy.

Smriti Mandhana wedding postponed: Palaash cried for 4 hours, says his mother Following the heart ailment of Smriti Mandhana's father, groom Palaash Muchhal, devastated by the news, was hospitalised in Mumbai with exhaustion, confirming the emotional depth of his bond with his future father-in-law.

Dharmendra Paradox: Star who ruled all genres paled before Bachchan, Rajesh Khanna Dharmendra delivered hits over three decades, yet never became an epoch-defining superstar like Rajesh Khanna or Amitabh Bachchan, revealing how Bollywood's genre politics shapes stardom

Kunickaa Sadanand on biggest regret in BB 19, dismisses claims of being favoured Kunickaa Sadanand exits Bigg Boss 19 two weeks ahead of the finale. She addresses rumours of favouritism and shares emotional regrets about her time inside the house.

Bigg Boss 19 episode 93: Full house gets nominated, Tanya-Malti clash 'Bigg Boss 19's latest episode was packed with chaos as multiple heated confrontations broke out over hygiene, friendship, and nominations. Tanya Mittal's attitude, Malti–Farrhana's fight and Amaal–Pranit's clash dominated a dramatic Day 93 where every contestant ultimately got nominated.

Bigg Boss Telugu 9 Day 78: Kalyan loses cool, Sanjana's comment puts her in danger A fierce two-stage nomination round triggered emotional meltdowns, explosive confrontations and a near-physical fight, pushing the house into its most volatile phase this season.

Jana Nayagan Malaysia event: Vijay's concert ticket prices, seating unveiled Thalapathy Vijay's 'Jana Nayagan' audio launch is set to take place in Malaysia, bringing together a star-studded lineup of singers with plans for a record-breaking crowd expected at the venue.

Celina Jaitly accuses husband of domestic, racist abuse, seeks compensation Actor Celina Jaitly Haag filed a domestic violence case alleging financial, verbal, and physical abuse. She seeks Rs 50 crore compensation and custody access, claiming Peter Haag blocked her access to their three children.

Screenshots suggesting Palaash Muchhal allegedly cheated on Smriti Mandhana go viral Smriti Mandhana and Palaash Muchhal's wedding was put on hold after a health scare. Soon after, alleged 'cheating' text screenshots surfaced. India Today cannot independently verify the authenticity of these screenshots and does not vouch for their accuracy.

Tamil actor Nivetha Pethuraj faces backlash over pro-stray dog remarks Actor Nivetha Pethuraj has come under scrutiny online after her comments at a pro-street dog rally in Chennai, where she urged for a shift in how incidents involving stray dogs are discussed and handled. Her statements, calling for compassion and practical solutions rather than fear, have sparked a polarising debate on social media.

Smriti-Palaash wedding festivities, hospitalisation, deleted pics: All that happened The wedding of Smriti Mandhana and Palaash Muchhal remains indefinitely postponed due to Smriti's father's health; this prompted Smriti to delete all photos, while an exhausted and stressed Palash was also hospitalised in Mumbai. A glimpse at their wedding timeline.

Tere Ishk Mein advance booking: Dhanush-Kriti's film ignites strong box office buzz Dhanush and Kriti Sanon's Tere Ishk Mein recorded impressive advance sales three days before release. The film promises a significant opening at the Indian box office, preferably in double digits.

Palak Muchhal visits brother Palaash amid wedding postponement with Smriti Mandhana Singer Palak Muchhal was seen at a Mumbai hospital amid reports of her brother Palaash Muchhal undergoing medical evaluation. The filmmaker was reportedly admitted following the postponement of his wedding with cricketer Smriti Mandhana.

Robert Pattinson to play negative characters in Dune Part 3, The Odyssey Actor Robert Pattinson is set to appear in three major films releasing in 2026. His roles include a romantic lead, a mythological character, and a villain in a sci-fi epic, signalling a diverse year ahead.

general news.headline: Arunachal is our territory: China denies Indian woman's harassment chargeThe woman, Pema Wangjom Thongdok, claimed her passport was declared "invalid" because it listed Arunachal Pradesh as her birthplace. India lodged a strong demarche, reaffirming that Arunachal Pradesh is indisputably Indian territory and that its residents can travel on Indian passports.

Flight ops normal as Ethiopia volcano ash drifts eastwards: Aviation MinistryAsh from Ethiopia's Hayli Gubbi volcanic eruption drifted over western and northern India on Tuesday, affecting some flight paths. The Civil Aviation Ministry said operations remain largely normal, with only precautionary rerouting and descent of select flights.

If you target me in Bengal, I'll shake the nation: Mamata warns BJP ahead of SIRPointing to the BJP's Bihar campaign, Mamata Banerjee alleged that no one there could see through the party's "game," adding that this would not be the case in Bengal. She also warned the BJP that she would take to the streets nationwide and "shake the entire nation" if she or her people were targeted in Bengal.

Wanted India to grovel: South Africa coach makes controversial remark in GuwahatiIND vs SA: South Africa coach Shukri Conrad sparked controversy in Guwahati by saying he wanted India to "grovel", reviving a historically sensitive term after his side dominated the hosts on Day 4 of the second Test in Guwahati.

Autophagy explained: Why Sonali Bendre's cancer post drew criticism from doctorsSonali Bendre shared how autophagy aided her cancer recovery journey. Her post sparked debate as doctors warn against viewing it as a proven treatment. But first, let's break down what autophagy is.

Cyclone Senyar intensifies, heavy showers likely in Tamil Nadu, Kerala, AndhraThe IMD said a depression over the Strait of Malacca and a low-pressure area over the southwest Bay will influence rainfall across southern and eastern regions. Heavy to very heavy rain is expected through the week. Thunderstorms with gusty winds are likely in multiple states.

No third contender, DK Shivakumar likely choice if Siddaramaiah replaced: SourcesCongress sources say the high command is evaluating a leadership change in Karnataka. If Siddaramaiah is replaced, DK Shivakumar is the likely choice, with minimal chance of a third contender. No final decision has been made.

Handles being run from Pak? X's location feature stirs political storm in IndiaX's new feature, which displays the region in which an account is based, has triggered a controversy in India. Several politically active accounts, especially those critical of the government, have been found to be based outside the country, giving BJP ammo to attack the opposition.

Screenshots suggesting Palaash Muchhal allegedly cheated on Smriti Mandhana go viralSmriti Mandhana and Palaash Muchhal's wedding was put on hold after a health scare. Soon after, alleged 'cheating' text screenshots surfaced. India Today cannot independently verify the authenticity of these screenshots and does not vouch for their accuracy.

Israeli PM Netanyahu cancelled India visit after Delhi blast? Centre clears airIsraeli reports said Netanyahu's visit was postponed over security fears following the blast near Delhi's Red Fort. However, government sources told India Today that it was misleading and factually incorrect.

PMO cracks whip on polluting vehicles in Delhi, pushes for EV expansionDelhi AQI: The high-level PMO meeting comes as Delhi's air quality remained 'very poor' for the second week, with some areas even recording 'severe' levels.

Yogi Adityanath says Mughals tried to Islamise India, cites Sikh Gurus' resistanceUttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath criticised Mughal rulers for attempting to Islamise India and suppress Hindu traditions, linking historical events to present-day religious identity. His remarks highlight ongoing political debates around history and cultural resurgence in India.

From UP village to Rs 35 LPA: Reddit user's decade of grit inspires IndiaA viral Reddit post has struck a chord across India as a UP man narrates his decade-long climb from family tragedy, debt, and responsibility to earning Rs 35 LPA. From raising siblings to rebuilding a home, his story stands out for its resilience, steady growth, and refusal to stop moving forward.
From Serenity to Celebration - Gujarat in All Its ShadesAnother destination that has stood the test of time and modernisation is Vadnagar.

You're misfit for secular Army: Supreme Court upholds Christian officer's dismissalThe officer had challenged the disciplinary action, arguing that being compelled to enter the temple violated his religious freedom, but the Supreme Court ruled that his conduct amounted to disobedience of a lawful command.

The man the US couldn't kill: Fidel Castro survived 634 assassination attemptsAs the face of the Cuban revolution and the nation's president, Fidel Castro bestrode the world stage for half a century, challenging Washington at every turn. From the Cuban Missile Crisis to surviving CIA plots, Castro never surrendered. November 25 marks the death anniversary of the Cuban revolutionary.

Boy, 6, mauled by neighbour's pitbull, ear torn off, horror caught on cameraA six-year-old boy suffered grievous injuries after being mauled by a neighbour's pitbull in northwest Delhi's Prem Nagar. The attack, captured on CCTV, resulted in the child losing his right ear.

Tata Sierra launched at Rs 11.49 lakh: Nostalgic SUV revived with modern techTata Motors has launched the iconic Sierra in a modern, premium avatar for 2025, blending classic design cues with advanced technology, fresh powertrains and a feature-rich, safety-focused package.

AQI crosses 300 in Mumbai's Mazagaon, civic body mulls GRAP-IV measuresBMC Commissioner Bhushan Gagrani said hospitals are reporting more respiratory complaints, and the civic body has begun intensified water sprinkling and issued notices to polluting sites.

Priyanka Chaturvedi urges crackdown on cancer-causing colour in roasted chanaShiv Sena MP Priyanka Chaturvedi has exposed the use of toxic auramine dye in roasted chana across India. Auramine is an industrial dye, banned for its carcinogenic properties.

Lupita Nyong'o was stereotyped in slave roles after Oscar win for 12 Years A SlaveDespite her Oscar win, Lupita Nyong'o initially only received offers for stereotypical slave roles. sports.headline: Wanted India to grovel: South Africa coach makes controversial remark in Guwahati IND vs SA: South Africa coach Shukri Conrad sparked controversy in Guwahati by saying he wanted India to "grovel", reviving a historically sensitive term after his side dominated the hosts on Day 4 of the second Test in Guwahati.

Want to see real fightback and determination from Indian batters: Parthiv Patel Parthiv Patel has urged the Indian batters to show fight and discipline on the final day of the Guwahati Test, with the hosts needing 522 runs to avoid a 0-2 whitewash against South Africa. He stressed technique, resilience and smart decision-making on a turning pitch.

Watch: Anil Kumble's reaction to KL Rahul getting bowled by Simon Harmer in Guwahati goes viral Anil Kumble's reaction in the commentary box went viral after KL Rahul was bowled by Simon Harmer on Day 4 of the Guwahati Test. The former India captain criticised Rahul's technique as India slipped deeper into trouble and edged closer to another home whitewash.

Did Virat Kohli's brother slam Gambhir for Test dip? Happens when you boss around IND vs SA: Vikas Kohli's jibe has added to the pressure on Gautam Gambhir as India struggle in Guwahati. Questions around leadership are now unavoidable.

Sri Lanka vs Zimbabwe, T20I tri-series, Match 5: Live Score and Updates from Rawalpindi SL vs ZIM, T20I tri-series, Match 5 Live Score and Updates: Zimbabwe have won the toss and opted to bat first. Sikandar Raza's men will join Pakistan in the final if they beat Sri Lanka on Tuesday.

Draw in Guwahati Test as good as a win: Ravindra Jadeja IND vs SA: Ravindra Jadeja said that managing to draw the Guwahati Test would be as good as a win for India, who ended Day 4 at 27 for two while chasing 549. India are looking to avoid a series defeat, having already lost the Kolkata Test earlier.

Watch: Virat Kohli arrives in Mumbai ahead of South Africa ODI series Virat Kohli has arrived in Mumbai ahead of India's ODI series against South Africa, entering with confidence after an unbeaten 74 against Australia. With KL Rahul leading in Shubman Gill's absence, India hopes to bounce back following a disappointing Test run.

Early blows in 549 chase kill hopes of draw as India face another home whitewash India vs South Africa, 2nd Test: South Africa tightened their grip on the Guwahti encounter as India wilted in the field with both bat and ball. After setting a 549-run target, South Africa dismissed Indian openers KL Rahul and Yashasvi Jaiswal, leaving the hosts reeling at 27 for 2.

England should have handled Travis Head better: Stuart Broad explains how Ashes 2025: Travis Head's blistering 123 off just 83 balls sealed a two-day win for Australia in Perth. Now, Stuart Broad has revealed the tactical errors that allowed the left-hander to run riot unchecked.

Test struggles not Gauti bhaiya's fault, he loves the Indian team: Suresh Raina India vs South Africa: Former India all-rounder Suresh Raina defended Gautam Gambhir, saying it's unfair to blame the head coach for batting failures in Test cricket. India are staring a 0-2 series defeat against South Africa in Guwahati.

Prithvi Shaw eyes IPL return, set to lead Maharashtra in Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy Prithvi Shaw begins a fresh chapter with Maharashtra as he looks to revive his career in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy. With the IPL auction approaching, a strong performance while leading the side in Gaikwad's absence could help him return to the league.

LSG sign ex-KKR support staff member as spin coach ahead of IPL 2026Lucknow Super Giants have roped in Carl Crowe as their new spin coach ahead of the upcoming IPL season. The Rishabh Pant-led side announced the arrival of the England-born coach on their social media platforms.

Mohammed Siraj suffers shoulder injury scare as India bowlers toil in GuwahatiMohammed Siraj suffered an injury scare during the second Test against South Africa in Guwahati, briefly leaving the field after landing awkwardly on his elbow while fielding on Day 4.

Can India chase 549 in Guwahati? Here's what Test history suggestsIND vs SA, 2nd Test: India face a daunting, world-record chase in the final innings to avoid losing the Test series at home. South Africa's commanding lead and disciplined batting have piled on the pressure, with no team ever having chased 400-plus in Asia.

Thorpe's widow claims late cricketer would be alive if England cricket helpedGraham Thorpe's widow believes the late England batter would still be alive today had he received better support from the cricketing world after leaving the national setup.

Gambhir can say whatever he wants, I don't care: Srikkanth slams Test selectionFormer India captain Kris Srikkanth criticised Gautam Gambhir for inconsistent Test team selections. His comments come after Indian batters failed in the first innings of the Guwahati Test after South Africa posted 489.

Hazlewood back in training, Cummins trains with pink ball before 2nd TestJosh Hazlewood and Pat Cummins took part in a crucial training session in Sydney on Tuesday as Australia stepped up their preparations for the second Ashes Test at the Gabba.

India set to formally get hosting rights of Commonwealth Games on November 26India is set to be formally approved as host of the 2030 Commonwealth Games on Wednesday. Ahmedabad will stage the centenary edition, strengthening India's bid to host the 2036 Olympics.

Ashes: Usman Khawaja's golf post sparks fresh debate amid injury rowVeteran Australian opener Usman Khawaja has reignited debate over his Ashes preparations after sharing a photo from a golf course on Instagram, just days after enduring a challenging first Test in Perth.

No place for Ruturaj: Ex-India cricketer tips Jaiswal to open with Rohit in SA ODIsFormer India batter Aakash Chopra welcomed Ruturaj Gaikwad's recall to India's ODI squad for the upcoming South Africa series, but predicted Yashasvi Jaiswal will be Rohit Sharma's opening partner. Chopra also raised concerns about Nitish Kumar Reddy's role and utilisation in the squad.

Man United deserved to lose: Amorim wishes his side had shown Everton's fightRuben Amorim conceded that Manchester United are still some distance from competing with the Premier League's leading sides after their 1-0 defeat to 10-man Everton on Monday.

Washington Sundar breaks silence on flexible batting position in India's Test sideIndia all-rounder Washington Sundar said he is happy to bat wherever the team needs him, adding that he enjoys taking on different roles whenever required.

India vs Pakistan set for February 15 in T20 World Cup 2026: ReportIndia and Pakistan will face each other on February 15, 2026, at the R Premadasa Stadium in Colombo during the Men's T20 World Cup. India and Pakistan are expected to be grouped with the USA, Netherlands and Namibia during the tournament as the full schedule will be revealed on Tuesday, November 25.

Pace, bounce and chaos: Jansen's hostile spell wrecks India in Guwahati TestMarco Jansen was at his devastating best on Day 3 of the second Test in Guwahati, delivering a menacing spell of 6 for 48. The left-arm quick rolled back the years as he peppered India with a relentless barrage of bouncers, forcing the batters into submission and dragging the hosts to their knees.

2nd Test Day 4 Highlights: India in big trouble in 549 chase in GuwahatiIndia vs South Africa live score 2nd Test Day 4 Highlights: Kuldeep Yadav and Sai Sudharsan survive but India find themselves in all sorts of trouble as they have lost both their openers and need 549 runs to win the match. Harmer and Jansen picked up a wicket each as the Proteas continued their domination of the match.

BCCI's domestic promise seems all talk: India's batting letdown in Guwahati proves itIndia's collapse in Guwahati has reignited questions about the BCCI's commitment to domestic cricket. Despite strong Ranji performers waiting in the wings, India's selection strategy leans heavily on youth, leaving the team exposed to another home Test whitewash.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
